title: REPORT: Inspection of Pump Station B-23. Anomaly detected: “human factor”.
author: master-gideon
body:
Task: final calibration of pump station B-23 before commissioning.

Course of inspection: recorded 5 (five) local temporal fluctuations, entered into the protocol. During further checks with a manual gravimetric plumb, a sixth anomaly was found that standard equipment did not register. The source of the anomaly was the on-duty operator, citizen Brokk-7. The subject showed signs of temporal-gravitational instability typical of a pre-collapse phase.

Measures taken: Under protocol 14.8 I was obliged to report the operator’s instability. However, given patrol response lag (up to 12 hours) and the risk of a cascade failure at the facility, I decided to temporarily localize the threat.

A falsified technical report was filed about a faulty pressure regulator on the operator’s panel. Subject Brokk-7 was removed from duty for 3 hours under the pretext of waiting for a repair crew. This window is sufficient for temporary self-stabilization of his field. This measure is more resource-efficient than eliminating the consequences of an explosion and paying compensation to the operator’s family. Trainee Mavir was instructed and signed the act.

Conclusion: The station is conditionally stable. I recommend adding “human factor” to the protocols as an admissible tolerance.

comments.author: supervisor-riggs
comments.body: Master Gideon, your report has been noted. As has the fact of willful document falsification. Expect a summons to the certification board. Protocol is not a recommendation — it is law.

replies.author: deicide-mentor
replies.body: those boards are filled with people who never held a plumb when a sector’s life depended on it. the old man did the right thing.

comments.author: techie-linus
comments.body: And the trainee you “instructed” — was he informed about the falsification?
